info:
Adjectives decline based on case, gender, number, and definiteness of the noun.

They are usually placed before the noun.

There are three types of adjective declensions: strong, weak, and mixed — depending on the presence of a determiner (e.g., der, ein).

Adjectives take different endings depending on whether they follow definite articles, indefinite articles, or no article.
